amendment.description: Amendment deletes language that exempted the Gulf of Mexico and the South Atlantic fisheries from requirements to reduce shrimp bycatch.
amendment.purpose: An amendment preprinted in the Congressional Record of October 17 as amendment No. 2, to strike provisions of the bill that would prevent the Commerce Department from requiring shrimp fishermen to use devices which would reduce the incidental killing of non-target species, until a study on such devices is completed.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goss amendment (A011) Agreed to by recorded vote: 294 - 129 (Roll no. 719).
